00019 namespace fft {
00020 
00021     // FFTW_PATIENT: run a lot of ffts to discover the best plan.
00022     // Will not use the multithreaded version unless the fft size
00023     // is reasonable enough
00024 
00025     // FFTW_MEASURE : run some ffts to find the best plan.
00026     // (first run should take some more seconds)
00027 
00028     // FFTW_ESTIMATE : dont run any ffts, just make an estimation.
00029     // Usually leads to suboptimal solutions
00030 
00031     // FFTW_DESTROY_INPUT : use the original input to store arbitaty data.
00032     // May yield better performance but the input is not usable any more.
00033     // Can be combined with all the above
00034     const uint FFTW_FLAGS = FFTW_ESTIMATE | FFTW_DESTROY_INPUT;
00035     // const uint FFTW_FLAGS = FFTW_ESTIMATE;// | FFTW_DESTROY_INPUT;
00036     const uint ELEMS_PER_THREAD_FFT = 10000;
00037     const uint ELEMS_PER_THREAD_RFFT = 15000;
00038 
00039     enum fft_type_t { FFT, IFFT, RFFT, IRFFT };
00040 
00041     struct API fft_plan_t {
00042         fftw_plan p; // fftw_plan
00043         uint n;      // size of the fft
00044         fft_type_t type;
00045         void* in;
00046         void* out;
00047     };
00048 
00049     static std::vector<fft::fft_plan_t> planV;
00050 
00051     static inline void real_to_complex(const std::vector<ftype>& in,
00052                                        std::vector<complex_t>& out) {
00053         assert(out.empty());
00054         out.reserve(in.size());
00055         for (const auto& real : in)
00056             out.push_back(complex_t(real, 0));
00057     }
00058 
00059     static inline void pack_to_complex(const std::vector<ftype>& in,
00060                                        std::vector<complex_t>& out) {
00061         assert(out.empty());
00062         assert(in.size() % 2 == 0);
00063         out.reserve(in.size() / 2);
00064         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < in.size(); i += 2)
00065             out.push_back(complex_t(in[i], in[i + 1]));
00066     }
00067 
00068     static inline void complex_to_real(const std::vector<complex_t>& in,
00069                                        std::vector<ftype>& out) {
00070         assert(out.empty());
00071         out.reserve(in.size());
00072         for (const auto& z : in)
00073             out.push_back(z.real());
00074     }
00075 
00076     static inline void unpack_complex(const std::vector<complex_t>& in,
00077                                       std::vector<ftype>& out) {
00078         assert(out.empty());
00079         out.reserve(2 * in.size());
00080         for (const auto& z : in) {
00081             out.push_back(z.real());
00082             out.push_back(z.imag());
00083         }
00084     }
00085 
00086     //#ifdef USE_FFTW
00087     static inline fftw_plan init_fft(const int n, complex_t* in, complex_t* out,
00088                                      const int sign = FFTW_FORWARD,
00089                                      const unsigned flag = FFTW_ESTIMATE,
00090                                      const int threads = 1) {
00091 #ifdef USE_FFTW_OMP
00092         if (threads > 1) {
00093             fftw_init_threads();
00094             fftw_plan_with_nthreads(std::min(
00095                 threads,
00096                 (int)((n + ELEMS_PER_THREAD_FFT - 1) / ELEMS_PER_THREAD_FFT)));
00097         }
00098 #endif
00099         fftw_complex *a, *b;
00100         a = reinterpret_cast<fftw_complex*>(in);
00101         b = reinterpret_cast<fftw_complex*>(out);
00102         return fftw_plan_dft_1d(n, a, b, sign, flag);
00103     }
00104 
00105     static inline fftw_plan init_rfft(const int n, ftype* in, complex_t* out,
00106                                       const unsigned flag = FFTW_ESTIMATE,
00107                                       const int threads = 1)
00108 
00109     {
00110 #ifdef USE_FFTW_OMP
00111         if (threads > 1) {
00112             fftw_init_threads();
00113             fftw_plan_with_nthreads(
00114                 std::min(threads, (int)((n + ELEMS_PER_THREAD_RFFT - 1) /
00115                                         ELEMS_PER_THREAD_RFFT)));
00116         }
00117 #endif
00118         fftw_complex* b;
00119         b = reinterpret_cast<fftw_complex*>(out);
00120         return fftw_plan_dft_r2c_1d(n, in, b, flag);
00121     }
00122 
00123     static inline fftw_plan init_irfft(const int n, complex_t* in, ftype* out,
00124                                        const unsigned flag = FFTW_ESTIMATE,
00125                                        const int threads = 1) {
00126 #ifdef USE_FFTW_OMP
00127         if (threads > 1) {
00128             fftw_init_threads();
00129             fftw_plan_with_nthreads(std::min(
00130                 threads,
00131                 (int)((n + ELEMS_PER_THREAD_FFT - 1) / ELEMS_PER_THREAD_FFT)));
00132         }
00133 #endif
00134         fftw_complex* b;
00135         b = reinterpret_cast<fftw_complex*>(in);
00136         return fftw_plan_dft_c2r_1d(n, b, out, flag);
00137     }

00139     static inline void run_fft(const fftw_plan& p) { fftw_execute(p); }
00140 
00141     static inline void destroy_fft(fftw_plan& p) { fftw_destroy_plan(p); }
00142 
00143     static inline void destroy_plans() {
00144         // std::cout<<"planV size = " << planV.size()<<"\n";
00145         for (auto& i : planV) {
00146             fftw_destroy_plan(i.p);
00147             fftw_free(i.in);
00148             fftw_free(i.out);
00149         }
00150         planV.clear();
00151     }

00155     static inline fft_plan_t find_plan(uint n, fft_type_t type, uint threads,
00156                                        std::vector<fft_plan_t>& v) {
00157         const uint flag = FFTW_FLAGS;
00158         auto it =
00159             std::find_if(v.begin(), v.end(), [n, type](const fft_plan_t& s) {
00160                 return ((s.n == n) && (s.type == type));
00161             });
00162 
00163         if (it == v.end()) {
00164             // std::cout << "I have to create a new plan :(\n";
00165             fft_plan_t plan;
00166             plan.n = n;
00167             plan.type = type;
00168 
00169             if (type == FFT) {
00170                 fftw_complex* in =
00171                     (fftw_complex*)fftw_malloc(sizeof(fftw_complex) * n);
00172                 fftw_complex* out =
00173                     (fftw_complex*)fftw_malloc(sizeof(fftw_complex) * n);
00174 
00175                 auto p = init_fft(n, reinterpret_cast<complex_t*>(in),
00176                                   reinterpret_cast<complex_t*>(out),
00177                                   FFTW_FORWARD, flag, threads);
00178                 plan.p = p;
00179                 plan.in = in;
00180                 plan.out = out;
00181             } else if (type == IFFT) {
00182 
00183                 fftw_complex* in =
00184                     (fftw_complex*)fftw_malloc(sizeof(fftw_complex) * n);
00185                 fftw_complex* out =
00186                     (fftw_complex*)fftw_malloc(sizeof(fftw_complex) * n);
00187                 auto p = init_fft(n, reinterpret_cast<complex_t*>(in),
00188                                   reinterpret_cast<complex_t*>(out),
00189                                   FFTW_BACKWARD, flag, threads);
00190                 plan.p = p;
00191                 plan.in = in;
00192                 plan.out = out;
00193 
00194             } else if (type == RFFT) {
00195                 ftype* in = (ftype*)fftw_malloc(sizeof(ftype) * n);
00196                 fftw_complex* out = (fftw_complex*)fftw_malloc(
00197                     sizeof(fftw_complex) * (n / 2 + 1));
00198                 auto p = init_rfft(n, in, reinterpret_cast<complex_t*>(out),
00199                                    flag, threads);
00200                 // std::cout << "threads : " << threads << "\n";
00201                 plan.p = p;
00202                 plan.in = in;
00203                 plan.out = out;
00204 
00205             } else if (type == IRFFT) {
00206                 ftype* out = (ftype*)fftw_malloc(sizeof(ftype) * n);
00207                 fftw_complex* in = (fftw_complex*)fftw_malloc(
00208                     sizeof(fftw_complex) * (n / 2 + 1));
00209                 auto p = init_irfft(n, reinterpret_cast<complex_t*>(in), out,
00210                                     flag, threads);
00211                 plan.p = p;
00212                 plan.in = in;
00213                 plan.out = out;
00214 
00215             } else {
00216                 std::cerr << "[fft::find_plan]: ERROR "
00217                           << "Wrong fft type!\n";
00218                 exit(-1);
00219             }
00220 
00221             v.push_back(plan);
00222             // planV.push_back(plan);
00223             return plan;
00224         } else {
00225             return *it;
00226         }
00227     }
00228 
00229     // Parameters are like python's numpy.fft.rfft
00230     // @in:  input data
00231     // @n:   number of points to use. If n < in.size() then the input is cropped
00232     //       if n > in.size() then input is padded with zeros
00233     // @out: the transformed array
00234     static inline void rfft(f_vector_t& in, complex_vector_t& out, uint n = 0,
00235                             const uint threads = 1) {
00236         if (n == 0)
00237             n = in.size();
00238         else
00239             in.resize(n);
00240 
00241         out.resize(n / 2 + 1);
00242 
00243         auto plan = fft::find_plan(n, RFFT, threads, planV);
00244         auto from = (ftype*)plan.in;
00245         auto to = (complex_t*)plan.out;
00246 
00247         std::copy(in.begin(), in.end(), from);
00248 
00249         run_fft(plan.p);
00250 
00251         std::copy(&to[0], &to[n / 2 + 1], out.begin());
00252     }
00253 
00254     // Parameters are like python's numpy.fft.fft
00255     // @in:  input data
00256     // @n:   number of points to use. If n < in.size() then the input is cropped
00257     //       if n > in.size() then input is padded with zeros
00258     // @out: the transformed array
00259     static inline void fft(complex_vector_t& in, complex_vector_t& out,
00260                            uint n = 0, const uint threads = 1) {
00261         if (n == 0)
00262             n = in.size();
00263 
00264         out.resize(n);
00265 
00266         auto plan = fft::find_plan(n, FFT, threads, planV);
00267         auto from = (complex_t*)plan.in;
00268         auto to = (complex_t*)plan.out;
00269 
00270         std::copy(in.begin(), in.end(), from);
00271 
00272         run_fft(plan.p);
00273 
00274         std::copy(&to[0], &to[n], out.begin());
00275     }
00276 
00277     // Parameters are like python's numpy.fft.ifft
00278     // @in:  input data
00279     // @n:   number of points to use. If n < in.size() then the input is cropped
00280     //       if n > in.size() then input is padded with zeros
00281     // @out: the inverse Fourier transform of input data
00282     static inline void ifft(complex_vector_t& in, complex_vector_t& out,
00283                             uint n = 0, const uint threads = 1) {
00284         if (n == 0)
00285             n = in.size();
00286 
00287         out.resize(n);
00288 
00289         auto plan = fft::find_plan(n, IFFT, threads, planV);
00290         auto from = (complex_t*)plan.in;
00291         auto to = (complex_t*)plan.out;
00292         std::copy(in.begin(), in.end(), from);
00293 
00294         run_fft(plan.p);
00295 
00296         std::transform(&to[0], &to[n], out.begin(),
00297                        std::bind2nd(std::divides<complex_t>(), n));
00298     }
00299 
00300     // Inverse of rfft
00301     // @in: input vector which must be the result of a rfft
00302     // @out: irfft of input, always real
00303     // Missing n: size of output
00304     static inline void irfft(complex_vector_t in, f_vector_t& out, uint n = 0,
00305                              const uint threads = 1) {
00306         n = (n == 0) ? 2 * (in.size() - 1) : n;
00307         // std::cout << "out size will be " << n << "\n";
00308         out.resize(n);
00309 
00310         auto plan = fft::find_plan(n, IRFFT, threads, planV);
00311         auto from = (complex_t*)plan.in;
00312         auto to = (ftype*)plan.out;
00313 
00314         std::copy(in.begin(), in.end(), from);
00315 
00316         run_fft(plan.p);
00317 
00318         std::transform(&to[0], &to[n], out.begin(),
00319                        std::bind2nd(std::divides<ftype>(), n));
00320     }
00321 
00322     // Same as python's numpy.fft.rfftfreq
00323     // @ n: window length
00324     // @ d (optional) : Sample spacing
00325     // @return: A vector of length (n div 2) + 1 of the sample frequencies
00326     static inline f_vector_t rfftfreq(const uint n, const ftype d = 1.0) {
00327         f_vector_t v(n / 2 + 1);
00328         const ftype factor = 1.0 / (d * n);
00329 #pragma omp parallel for
00330         for (int i = 0; i < (int)v.size(); ++i) {
00331             v[i] = i * factor;
00332         }
00333         return v;
00334     }
00335 }
